title.narrative: 5.1. GRAVE CHILD RTS VIOLATIONS, CAAF

description.narrative: Evidence generated by improved monitoring and reporting on grave child rights violations based on UNSCRs 1612, 1882 and 1888 used to inform advocacy and response mechanism in ensuring boys, girls and young people associated with armed force/groups are released, reunified with families and benefit from sustainable socio-economic reintegration assistance in selected conflict areas, which contributes to Child Protection And Emergencies, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Girls and boys affected by armed conflict and other emergencies are better protected from violence, abuse and exploitation

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF INTERIOR LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND RECONCILIATION SOUTHWEST STATE OF SOMALIA

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Somalia Support Centre (USSC) P.O. Box 44145 - 00100 Nairobi

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evidence generated by improved monitoring and reporting on grave child rights violations based on UNSCRs 1612, 1882 and 1888 usedto inform advocacy and response mechanism in ensuring boys, girls and young people associated with armed force/groups are released,reunified with families and benefit from sustainable socio-economic reintegration assistance in selected conflict areas

description.narrative: UNICEF continues to co-chair the Country Task Force on grave child rights violations in Somalia through which 5,225 violations affecting 4,160 children were documented in 2017. Advocacy efforts by UNICEF and other UN agencies ensured the release of 40 children detained for alleged association with armed groups. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:05/01/2018
